intro: Wendlandia teysmanniana, commonly known as the golden trumpet vine, is a striking tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features heart-shaped, velvety leaves and can grow as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
